title: Death Toll
opening: Ignatz and Raphael, two sons of merchant families, set out to put an end to a series of monster attacks on merchants in Alliance territory.

intro.speaker: Raphael
intro.line: So basically we just gotta defeat their leader, right? Then why don't we approach from...ugh! That won't work at all! Horses won't fit through there! I can't figure this out! I give up.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Try to calm down and think it through.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Shall we go over it one more time?

intro.speaker: Raphael
intro.line: But enemies never move how you want them to in a real battle, do they? I reckon I learn better on the battlefield.

intro.speaker: Ignatz
intro.line: Professor! I need to speak with you.

intro.speaker: Raphael
intro.line: Ignatz! You all right?

intro.speaker: Ignatz
intro.line: I received a letter from my brother back home. There's some disturbing news.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: What's going on?

intro.speaker: Ignatz
intro.line: Monsters have been attacking merchants within the Alliance territories.

intro.speaker: Raphael
intro.line: That happens all the time. I mean, that's how my parents died, so...

intro.speaker: Ignatz
intro.line: Ah, Raphael! I didn't mean to bring up such a sensitive topic in your presence.

intro.speaker: Raphael
intro.line: Hey, don't worry about that. C'mon, let's hear the rest of it.

intro.speaker: Ignatz
intro.line: Very well. These attacks seem to be focused on specific merchants.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Like who?

intro.speaker: Ignatz
intro.line: Those who are traveling from the territory of House Gloucester to the Riegan Dukedom. Merchants traveling in the opposite direction, from Riegan to Gloucester, don't suffer nearly as many attacks.

intro.speaker: Raphael
intro.line: That doesn't make any sense. Someone's gotta deal with those monsters though.

intro.speaker: Ignatz
intro.line: Agreed. At this rate, my father and brother can't conduct business without risking their lives. Professor, could you assist me? I need your help exterminating these creatures.

intro.speaker: Raphael
intro.line: Now you're talking! I'm going too! I'm not learning anything in a classroom! You're gonna go, right, Professor? Don't you wanna help these folks?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: We depart at once.

intro.speaker: Raphael
intro.line: Yeah! I knew you couldn't resist!

intro.speaker: Ignatz
intro.line: Thank you so much, Professor! And Raphael, I can't begin to express my gratitude.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Not right now.

intro.speaker: Raphael
intro.line: Seriously? Can't you see how important this is to Ignatz?

intro.speaker: Ignatz
intro.line: Ah, no, that's perfectly understandable. I'm sure the professor has much to do. But let me know if you change your mind, would you? If you can't come, I'll try asking some of the knights.

battle.speaker: Ignatz
battle.line: Look! The monsters are attacking those merchants again.

battle.speaker: Raphael
battle.line: Looks like there are some humans mixed in there! Maybe they're controlling the monsters! If they are, do you think we just have to take out the leader?

battle.speaker: Ignatz
battle.line: Let's get started, before it's too late!

battle.speaker: Raphael
battle.line: The merchants can probably escape, but we gotta get rid of those enemies who are blocking the path!

battle.speaker: Ignatz
battle.line: Look, a drawbridge! We can use that to cross, but we'll need to lower it first.

battle.speaker: Raphael
battle.line: Oh no! Looks like we just lost one of the merchants!

battle.speaker: Ignatz
battle.line: Come on... Let's try to save the rest of them.

battle.speaker: Ignatz
battle.line: No! We couldn't save any of them?!

battle.speaker: Raphael
battle.line: Aaargh! They can't get away with hurting those merchants! I'm gonna make them pay!

battle.speaker: Alliance General
battle.line: What do you think you're doing? Don't get in the way of our duty!

battle.speaker: Ignatz
battle.line: Your duty? You're letting monsters wreak havoc on innocent people!

battle.speaker: Alliance General
battle.line: Shut it! It's got nothing to do with you!

battle.speaker: Alliance General
battle.line: I'm not looking forward to telling the count...

battle.speaker: Raphael
battle.line: Looks like we took care of 'em!

battle.speaker: Ignatz
battle.line: That man mentioned the count. What could Count Gloucester have to do with all this?

end.speaker: Merchant
end.line: Thank you so much! We're safe now and it's all due to your efforts! I can't bear to think what might have happened if you hadn't shown up.

end.speaker: Raphael
end.line: Yay! A happy ending for everyone!

end.speaker: Merchant
end.line: Thank you so much! We're safe now, but it's a shame we weren't all lucky enough to escape... We might've all met the same fate if you hadn't shown up.

end.speaker: Raphael
end.line: I'm real sorry we couldn't save everyone...

end.speaker: Ignatz
end.line: If you don't mind me asking....were you headed to the Riegan Dukedom?

end.speaker: Merchant
end.line: We were. We traveled around the Alliance selling our wares. I heard this route was dangerous, but...

end.speaker: Ignatz
end.line: Dangerous, you say. Are you referring to the recent cases of merchants being attacked on that route?

end.speaker: Merchant
end.line: That's right. We can't turn a profit without going to Derdriu. I don't know what Count Gloucester is thinking.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: This is the count's doing?

end.speaker: Ignatz
end.line: I had a feeling it might be. You're certain?

end.speaker: Merchant
end.line: Looks that way. I think he's unhappy with merchants contributing to House Riegan's wealth. It seems like he's been at odds with them forever. They say even the previous Duke Riegan's death...

end.speaker: Raphael
end.line: Was that the count's fault too?

end.speaker: Merchant
end.line: It's only a rumor, but it was Count Gloucester himself who lured the late Duke Riegan out. If I recall correctly...he invited the duke to his estate to strike a deal on some valuable art pieces. I believe the duke brought a pair of merchants with him to assess the pieces in question, but...

end.speaker: Merchant
end.line: Alas, it seems those merchants lost their lives alongside him. A terrible misfortune. I wish these nobles wouldn't get us common folk mixed up in their feuds. You came from Garreg Mach, right? I'll send a token of our thanks over later.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Those merchants who lost their lives...

end.speaker: Raphael
end.line: Yeah, that was my ma and pa.

end.speaker: Ignatz
end.line: My parents received the request initially, but they had other business. They recommended Raphael's parents as substitutes. We could never have imagined...

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: And Count Gloucester, isn't he...

end.speaker: Ignatz
end.line: Yes, he's Lorenz's fath--

end.speaker: Raphael
end.line: OK, OK! That's enough of that! It's just a rumor, right? So, who cares? Even if it's true, that's our parents' business. It's got nothing to do with us.

end.speaker: Ignatz
end.line: But you--

end.speaker: Raphael
end.line: You got no idea what really happened, right, Ignatz? And I bet Lorenz doesn't know either! The way I see it, it was monsters that killed my parents. They died in an accident. I got no reason to hate anyone or blame somebody else for their deaths. I don't have time for that. I got my little sis to worry about instead.

end.speaker: Ignatz
end.line: Raphael...

end.speaker: Raphael
end.line: Now that that's settled, let's head back! What do you think that merchant's gonna send us? I hope it's food!

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Raphael is a nice guy.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Raphael is a good man.

end.speaker: Ignatz
end.line: Yes. He really is.
